name: Lead DevOps Engineer
description:
SHORT DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a strong experienced technical person to join and lead our DevOps team.

If you are a hardworking and result-oriented person, please apply now!

THE MAIN TASK IS

to design, construct, and maintenance of infrastructure to achieve high availability. Design and implementation of dynamically generated runtimes, blue-green deployments (later canary), CI / CD support, and development.

OUR STACK

OS: Debian, Ubuntu;

Virtualization: KVM, Proxmox;

Service orchestration: Kubernetes, also Docker Swarm;

Monitoring systems: Prometheus, Grafana, also Zabbix;

Configuration management: Ansible, also Salt;

Storages and DBMS: ceph, MinIO, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, ClickHouse;

Message brokers: RabbitMQ, Kafka;

Revision control and CI/CD tools: GitLab;

Cloud services: Amazon S3, EKS, Cloudfront;

Scripting: Python, bash.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience at least 3 years;
  • Willingness and ability to work with linux/unix;
  • You are ready to deal with nginx, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and others like RabbitMQ, redis, memcached, zookeeper;
  • Understanding of the main distributives - Debian, Ubuntu;
  • Desire to create monitorings and charts, to organize infrastructure;
  • Ability to write scripts on shell / perl / python and desire to reach fault tolerance.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Optimization of project architecture for heavy loads, automation of “manual” processes;
  • Research of new technologies and their implementation in existing projects;
  • Supporting production and testing environments;
  • Organization of the process of applications delivery, their updates;
  • Data visualization, organization of the collection, and analysis of project metrics;
  • Managing DevOps team, participation in the recruitment process.

BENEFITS

  • Comprehensive health insurance;
  • Professional growth, extra education opportunities;
  • Support in the relocation process (if you are ready to relocate);
  • Being a part of an international team focused on excellence in product development;
  • Language courses;
  • Awesome corporate events and team buildings;
  • Best new hardware for a comfortable job;
  • 100% paid sick leave;
  • Welfare (financial support in critical situations);
  • Gifts for significant life events (marriage, childbirth, etc).
